bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Library of Congress, July [19--]

div1.p: Laura Carter requests books from the Library of Congress for use in a yellow fever bibliography.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Library of Congress, July [19--]
div1.opener:
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
July
Charging Desk
Library of Congress,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Madame:
div1.p:
May I respectfully request the renewal of the following
books, withdrawn from the Library in accordance with my permit,
for use in my bibliographic work on the History of Yellow Fever:...
1: Hakluyt, Richard
The Principal Navigations, voyages, traffiques and
discoveries of the English nation... (ed. 1885-90) vol. xi (1889)
2: Walckenaer, Charles Athanase
Collection...de voyages, 1842. vol. i
3: Espinosa, Alonso de
The Guanches of Tenerife...
Hakluyt trans. 1907
4: Núñez de la Peña, Juan
Conquista...de las islas de la Gran Canaria...1676
5: Pop, C. F.
Geneeskundig tijdshchfiftjusor de zeemagt
6: La Roche, Réné
Yellow fever,...1855 (2 vols.)
5: Mendieta, Geromino de
Historia eclesiastica Indiana...1870
With sincere appreciation of the courtesies accorded me, I remain

closer.seg:
P. S. I am returning four Portugese books in Portuguese and one in
French on the history of Brazil,
L. A. C.
